caption: Place was overall normal with outdoor seating on 01/21. Burger was tough at medium well, English muffin and smoke salmon salty and Mac and cheese was extremely wet. Would not recommend. Shocked others rating so well!
Cant get enough of this place! Please try the lamb pasta! You're welcome!
Besides the view, nothing spectacular. We needed somewhere with a view on such a nice day and it worked out. There wasn't much of a selection for brunch. Nonetheless, it worked out.

Great brunch! Had an excellent avocado toast with eggs and smoked salmon. Friends had the steak and the lobster roll, which were given thumbs up as well. Good coffee, great dessert, friendly staff and a nice pet friendly seating area. Will be back!
Nice to visit.

This is really good place for brunch with friends on Sunday. Staff is very nice, everyone is so friendly and helpful. Our hostess , I think her name was Remeta, was really nice and helpful with menu and helped us make our choices. Brunch menu is delicious and tasty.
Limited menu for covid. Portions small but good. Nice view of Manhattan.
lousy service, I'll never be back.  and after all the bad experience my account was charged twice as bad.
Great view and delicious food! My husband brought me here for my birthday and we both loved it. We ordered the deviled eggs and fries to share and they were both incredible!

I ordered the burger and fries for pick-up while biking in Brooklyn Bridge park. This burger and fries are $20 worth of deliciousness! The burger is pretty big. I shared the burger and fries with my friend and neither of us wanted ice cream after as we had planned.

Amazing view of the Lower Manhattan and New York City skyline.  Delicious food!  Deviled eggs were fresh.  I highly recommend the Avocado toast with Salmon!  Yummmmmmmmyyy!! I recommend this place!  Easy to get to and nice area.  Service was great.

I came here with a friend for Sunday brunch and the food was spectacular! The beautiful city views and location were the cherry on top. We got our food quickly and our waitress was very kind. I’ll definitely be back and recommend the smoked salmon eggs benedict.
Fabulous food & service along with scenery.

I cannot praise this restaurant enough! We had a family lunch there last Wednesday. The location is great, in front of the marina with stunning view of Lower Manhattan. Open Table had confirmed our reservation for 6 at 1:00 pm, but when we arrived we learned that they opened at 3:00!  However, a manager soon appeared and said he would sit us down and serve us shortly.  The menu was blissfully short and very attractive.  Simba took our order and brought us two delicious complimentary starters (guacamole and fried calamari). We ate lobster rolls, hamburger and mussels, with the best French fries this side of the Pond. Each dish was excellent! At the end of our meal we were treated to three large tastings of their desserts of the day! A wonderful restaurant all around! We will be back!
Try the sea bass! Light, full of flavor, grilled to perfection.

We went last weekend with my husband, this is an amazing place !! The food was delicious, you definitely see that the chef loves his job and that he really wants to satisfy the customer, it s not just about feeding people it's way more, he wants you to appreciate the products and makes your dinner unforgettable ! The cooking was perfect, and the mix of spices was delightful ! The staff therr is also really professional and cares really much , they really want you to have a wonderful time. We had Noha as a waiter and wine specialist, he was really nice and helpful , and his advices were priceless 😊 I highly recommend that place, and will definitely stop by again 😊 thank you so much for your kindness !!
Very very good thank you tanks to waiters

This place has pretty good food in one of the oddest interiors I've seen in a while. Apparently, there was a great deal of money spent on this build out but it  looks like someone went crazy with all the fixtures and didn't have a clear vision for what the place should look like or maybe they did? We counted at least eight different lighting fixtures. It feels like a sports bar, a diner, and restaurant hotel rolled into one. The view is so incredible they could have kept it super clean and modern. Doilies and placemats? Seems very dated.  It seems like it should be casual hence the sailor themed outfits of the wait staff that are not flattering (few people can wear horizontal stripes) and the managers are wearing full suits. The food is very safe and general and nicely executed, which is probably a smart move considering they will have a very varied clientele with all the tourists in the park. I wish the space was more appealing to sit in. I found it very distracting.
This place has the best views and outstanding food!
(Translated by Google) Like in a good movie😉  (Original) Kao u dobrom filmu😉

Decided to check this spot out while in Brooklyn Heights. It was a Friday night , we were seated right away. Got a good view to the city from this restaurant. The waiter was super nice and went over the whole menu and suggested a few items. We went with the Cheese Plate , which had variety of cheeses with jam. Also had the Grilled Calamari as the appetizer. For the main course we had the roasted Crystal Valley chicken and the painted Hills ribeye , they were both delicious. Presentation was top notch.  Ambiance - 10/10 Service - 10/10 Views - Excellent WiFi- Not Sure Large Groups- Yes Parking - Paid Garage around the corner  Definitely booking a table for July 4th . Best spot to have dinner watching the  fireworks.

Ate here today for the first time for Thanksgiving lunch. I wasn’t disappointed! Service was really great. Pleasant hosts and servers that were attentive and very easy going. The restaurant has such a nice vibe to it. Very classy and upscale, but very relaxed and cozy feeling at the same time. It’s very beautifully decorated and clean. Food was incredible. Very appealing to look at and eat. The food looked like something Gordon Ramsey would cook; I was quite impressed. They also have a nice drink menu and great options to choose from. I personally loved their soup and their fries. Their pecan pie was honestly the best I’ve ever had in my life. Another great thing about this restaurant is they are very kid friendly. Overall a really great place to come with family or friends (or both) and enjoy a wonderful meal. Highly recommend!
Very bad expérience ! the 3 of us eated hamburger at this restaurant for lunch today and we are all sick tonight.....😡😡
Guacamole tasted bad, drink was mediocre and my partners “Coca-Cola” was some watery coke soda. View is good but not worth the hype.

Indoor and outdoor seating area. Easily accessible and with nice view on lower Manhattan. We ordered oysters which tasted very fresh and as main burgers and lobster roll - both very tasty. Don’t forget to look at the dessert menu. The cakes were delicious.
Great place with an amazing view of the skyline. Recommend the flatbreads and sliders!
Love this place! The food and service is even better than the view, which is amazing. Panoramic view of the Manhattan skyline.
Great and fast service.  Good menu though the entrees were not as great as they could have been.  The deserts are significantly better.

One of our favorite chefs is the executive chef at Estuary and that was the primary reason we went to Estuary.  Estuary is pleasantly located along Brooklyn waterfront on Bridge Park Dr with a coveted view of the Financial District skyline.  I can’t say much about the inside of the restaurant as we sat outside and soaked up the environment. Chef Danny Brown curated some decadent meals - we had the Caesar Salad, Salmon, Cream of Spinach and Branzino en Cocotte.  The dishes were all presented well, flavorful and very innovative (not surprise). The wine list, however, leave a lot to be desired.  I am very glad Chef Danny Brown is making waves in Brooklyn, but as a Queens residence, I feel the need to say, it all started in Queens. #estuarybrasserieandbar #chefdannybrown #dannybrown

Love the Food and the drinks . Great food dessert !..❤ Great view And Payard is the best chief in the world we know him from his Restaurant  in New York City  love all his  Creation of food and desserts. It's worth the trip from Manhattan  from New York. And the Coffee  cake is so Amazing! Thank you Mr Payard 😁❤💖  From  Jo Anne and Cisco
Great food, great service.  A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
Incredible location on the Brooklyn waterfront with Danny Brown in the kitchen creating fantastic food. Worth a trip!
Great service, great food and killer view.
Great restaurant! Service was overall good, despite drinks taking awhile. And the food was excellent. After they work out the kinks this place will be amazing.

New place. Outstanding food, manhattan skyline view, handsome restaurant and a lively bar.  All Good!  Had dinner: scallop & leek tart was a standout dish. lobster roll fresh & crisp with a hint of fennel on a perfectly toasted brioche. Branzino was exceptionally moist and meaty.  Devils food cake dessert was a perfect ending.   Highly recommend!
